hook.text: Jealousy isn't a sign of love. It's a sign of low trust â€” a fear that the bond isn't strong enough to hold.

buildup.text: Evolutionary psychology framed jealousy as protective. But modern research shows chronic jealousy damages relationships.

discovery.text: Secure people feel jealousy too. The difference: they communicate it openly instead of acting on it destructively.

twist.text: Controlling behavior disguised as jealousy is one of the earliest warning signs of emotional abuse.

climax.text: Healthy jealousy is a signal to talk. Toxic jealousy is a signal to control. The response defines the relationship.

punchline.text: Jealousy is a signal. Healthy people talk about it. Toxic people weaponize it.

quiz.question: What distinguishes healthy jealousy from toxic jealousy?
options: Whether you communicate it or use it to control
